shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction (fols. 1ra-5v) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fol. 1ra-vb l.11) - Canon tables (fols. 2r-5v) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 6ra-41ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fol. 6ra-vb) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 10ra-41ra) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 41rb-83ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 48 titles (fol. 41rb-vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 45ra-71ra l.5) IV) Gospel of Luke (fols. 71ra l.9-130vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 82 titles (fol. 71ra l.9-vb) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols. 73ra-109vb l.6) V) Gospel of John (fols. 109vb l.9-139vb) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fol. 109vb l.9-l.31) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 111ra-139vb)
Additiones 1-3.

donors.donor: ʿƎqwǝboy (ʿƎqwǝbay?) s. Additio 1. The preceding word, possibly the first part of the name of the donor or owner, is illegible.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired with threads. The Ms. has been rebound with modern synthetic threads. The spine cover is missing. The leather cover is preserved in 75%. Fols. 9-31 are damaged in the lower left corner. Holes in the margins of fol. 71. Holes carefully amended on fols. 19, 21, 26, 48, 61, 64, 65, 74, 76, 81, 82, 95, 96, 97, 98, 109, 120, 121, 123, 124, 128, 132, 133, 135.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather (partly missing); remains of parchment pastedowns (?). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, x-form, dot fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of some quires, close to the head of the codex, e.g., in quires III, VI, IX. Some quires are reinforced by parchment guards.

squires.squire:
I(6/fols. 1r-6v) – II(3; s.l.: 3, stub before 1/fols. 7r-9v) – III(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 5; 5, stub after 2/fols. 10r-15v) – ፪IV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 16r-23v) – V(8/fols. 24r-31v) – VI(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5/fols. 32r-38v) – VII(3; s.l.: 2, stub after 2/fols. 39r-41v) – VIII(6/fols. 42r-50v) – IX(6; s.l.: 2, stub after 4; 5, stub after 1/fols. 51r-56v) – X(5; s.l.: 2, stub after 4/fols. 57r-61v) – XI(6/fols. 62r-67v) – XII(4/fols. 68r-71v) – XIII(7; s.l.: 1, stub after 6/fols. 72r-79v) – XIV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 79r-86v) – XV(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 87r-94v) – XVI(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 95r-103v) – XVII(5; s.l.: 5, stub before 1/fols. 104r-108v) – XVIII(9; s.l.: 2, stub after 8/fols. 109r-117v) – XIX(6/fols. 118r-123v) – XX(6/fols. 124r-130v) – XXI(6/fols. 131r-136v) – XXII (4; s.l.: 2, stub after 1/fols. 137r-139v)
Quires VII (attached by means of crude thong stitches), fol. 43, quire VIII, X, XI, XXII are reinforced by parchment guards. Folded strips of dark parchment are inserted in the centre fold of quires XII, XX and XXII.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the Canon tables.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Ethiopic numeral “6” looks like “compressed” numeral “7” (s., e.g., lists of the “tituli”), but the numerals have “rings”.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; headings and incipits of the texts (in alternating red and black lines); parts of the Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus; elements of the Canon tables; the word mǝʿǝraf; “tituli” written in the upper margin; lines starting and closing the list of the “tituli” (fols. 6r, 41va, 71vb, 109vb); numbers of the “tituli”; closing line of each Gospel with the stichometry; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the Ethiopic numerals; Chi Rho signs; legends above and below the miniatures.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The list of the “tituli” of the Gospel of Matthew is preceded by an unusually long introduction (fol. 6r). - The “tituli” of the Gospel of Matthew are not numbered. - The “tituli” are written ink in the upper or lower margins. - Some letters and at times entire words on fol. 1rv are faded or blurred. - Readings for particular occasions are separated from each with a black line occasionally ornamented at the ends (e.g., fol. 12rb l.6, 13ra l.7). - Quotation signs resemble the letter ነ with a “ring” (e.g., fols. 13va ls. 13-26, 23rb ls. 10-20). - There is a small red cross and a small black cross on the margins of some fols. (above the Chi-Ro sign). Their function has not been determined (e.g., fols. 32rb l.11, 32va l.36, 33rb l.1, 35va l.10). - Some “tituli” are written in tiny letters in black ink in the upper margin, at the very edge of pages. Perhaps they served the scribe to plan how to distribute the text. At times they are partly cut off (fols. 18rv, 19r, 27r, 28r, 29r, 33r, 37rv, 39r, 40v, 48r, 77r, 80ra, 101rb, 101vb, 102rab). - The numbering of the chapters of the Gospel of Matthew is faulty since the number 47 (fol. 31ra) is followed by 59 (fol. 31vb) and 51 (fol. 32ra). - The “tituli” in the Gospels of Luke and John are only occasionally numbered. Also, the Chi Ro sign in the Gospel of Mark, Luke and John is much less often used than in the Gospel of Matthew.

additional.cont: Fol. 1vb: Donation note.
additional.det: The note is written in a crude hand. It mentions the donor of the Ms., <...> ʿƎqwǝboy (ʿƎqwǝbay?; the first part of the name is illegible).

additional.cont: Fol. 6vb: Protective prayer with ˀasmat, or a list of (Muslim) names (?).
Fol. 41v: Note concerning a legal issue.
additional.det: The recent extensive note (occupying originally more than half of the page), written in blue pen, has been effaced; only few remaining words can be discerned.

extras.extra: Cues for the rubricator (referring to the “tituli”) are written in small script in the uper margin of some fols.; on some fols. they are trimmed off.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quire mark is written in the upper left corner of fol. 16r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margins indicating liturgical occasions on which a given section should be recited, e.g., fol. 78va: ዘዓቢይ፡ ጾም. - Coloured threads are inserted into fols. 19, 67, 74, 75, 116.

miniature.details: In red, green, yellow, orange and black colours; geometric and floral motifs.

miniature.info: Fol. 7r: Enoch, Noah, Melchizedek, Abraham, Isaac, Jacob.
miniature.details: Upper part: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ነቢያት “Images of the Holy Prophets“ ሄኖክ ጸሐፊ “Enoch the Scribe“ ቅዱስ፡ ኖኅ “Holy Noah“ ቅዱስ፡ መልከጼደክ “Holy Melchizedek“ Lower part: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ አበዊነ፡ አብርሃም፡ ይስሐቅ፡ ወያዕቆብ “Images of our holy fathers Abraham, Isaac and Jacob“

miniature.info: Fol. 7v: Job, Moses, Samuel, David, Solomon, Sirach.
miniature.details: Upper part: Legend on the left: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኢዮብ፡ ጻድቅ “Image of holy Job the Righteous“ Legend in the middle: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሙሴ፡ ሊቀ፡ ነቢያት። “Image of holy Moses the Chief of the Prophets“ Legend on the right: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሳሙኤል፡ “Image of holy Samuel“ Lower part: Legend on the left: ሥዕለ፡ ዳዊት፡ ንጉሥ “Image of David the King“ Legend in the middle: ሰሎሞን፡ ወልዱ “Image of Solomon his son“ Legend on the right: ሲራክ ጸሐፊ “Image of Sirach the Scribe“

Upper part: Legend on the left: ኤልያስ፡ ቀናኢ። “Image of Elijah the Zealous“ Legend in the middle: ኢሳይያስ፡ ልዑለ ቃል። “Image of Isaiah of the Exalted Word“ Legend on the right: ኤርምያስ፡ ካህን፡ “Image of Jeremiah the Priest“ Lower part: Legend on the left: ሕዝቄል። “Ezekiel“ Legend in the middle: ዳንኤል፡ “Daniel“ Legend on the right: እዝራ፡ ጸሐፌ፡ ጥበቢሁ(?)፡ ለልዑል “Ezra the Scribe of Wisdom (?) of the Most High“

miniature.info: Fols. 8v, 9r: Virgin Mary with her Child, Archangels Michael and Gabriel, a host of angels.
miniature.details: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ እግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁር፡ ወልዳ፡ ጸሎታ፡ የሀሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን “Image of Our Lady Mary with her beloved Son, may her prayer be with us, forever and ever, Amen”
Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወንጌላዊ። “Image of Saint Matthew the Evangelist“, frontispiece miniature.

Upper part: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ፲ወ፪፡ ደቂቀ፡ ነቢያት፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ አሜን። “Image of the 12 Minor Prophets, may their prayer be with us, Amen”. Legend on the left: ሆሴዕ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Hosea” Legend in the middle: አሞጽ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Amos” Legend on the right: ሚክያስ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Micah” Lower part: Legend on the left: ኢዩኤል፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Joel” Legend in the middle: አብድዩ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Obadiah” Legend on the right: ዮናስ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Jonah”

Upper part. Legend on the left: ናሖም፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Nahum” Legend in the middle: እንባቆም፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Habakkuk” Legend on the right: ሶፎንያስ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Zephaniah” Lower part: Legend on the left: ሐጌ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Haggai” Legend in the middle: ዘካርያስ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Zechariah” Legend on the right: ምልክያስ፡ ነቢይ። “Prophet Malachi”

miniature.info: Fol. 43r: St. George, St. Victor, St. Mercurius.
miniature.details: Upper part: Legend on the left: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ጊዮርጊስ። “Image of Saint George“ Legend on the right: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፊቅጦር። “Image of Saint Victor” Lower part: Saint Mercurius pierces Decius. Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መርቆሬዎስ፡ ዘከመ፡ ውግእ፡ ለዳኪዩስ፡ ዕልው። “Image of Saint Mercurius piercing heretic Decius”
Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማርቆስ፡ ወንጌላዊ። “Image of Saint Mark the Evangelist“, frontispiece miniature.

Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ሐዋርያተ፡ በ˂…˃ዑ፡ በረከቶሙ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ አሜን። “Image of Saint Apostles, may their blessing be with us, Amen”. Upper part: Legend on the left: ጴጥሮስ፡ ሊቀ፡ ሐዋርያት። “Peter the Head of the Apostles” Legend in the middle: እንድርያስ። “Andrew” Legend on the right: ያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ ዘብዲዎስ። “James son of Zebedee” Lower part: Legend on the left: ፊልጶስ። “Philip” Legend in the middle: ናትናኤል። “Nathanael” Legend on the right: በርቶሎሜዎስ። “Bartholomew”

Upper part: Legend on the left: ቶማስ። “Thomas” Legend in the middle: ያዕቆብ፡ ወልደ፡ እልፍዮስ። “James son of Alphaeus” Legend on the right: ታዴዎስ። “Thaddeus” Lower part: Legend on the left: ማቲያስ፡ ሠናየ፡ ዕፃ። “Matthias of the Fortune Lot” Legend in the middle: ያዕቆብ እኁሁ ለእግዚእነ። “James the Brother of the Lord” Legend on the right: ጳውሎስ። “Paul”

miniature.info: Fol. 72r: St. Claudius, St. Theodore, St. ʾAboli, St. Marmǝhnam.
miniature.details: Upper part: Legend on the left: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ገላውድየስ። “Saint Claudius” Legend on the right: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቴዎድሮስ። “Saint Theodore” Lower part: Legend on the left: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አቦሊ። “Image of Saint ʾAboli” Legend in the middle: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ማርምህናም። “Image of Saint Marmǝhnam ”
Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሉቃስ፡ ወንጌላዊ። “Image of Saint Luke the Evangelist“, frontispiece miniature.

drawing.info: An incomplete drawing of an equestrian saint: the inner side of the front board.
drawing.details: The drawing depicts an equestrian saint and a rear part of another horse which is partly covered by a turn-in (cf. miniature on fol. 43r lower part: St. Mercurius pierces Decius). It is made on a piece of parchment that serves as an inlay and is positioned upside-down.

drawing.info: Fols. 14r, 20r, 30v, 43v, 36vb, 48ra, 61v, 66v, 106r: Crude drawings of a cross.
drawing.details: In pencil (probably they correspond to the name of the feast next to which they are drawn).

frames.frame: - Fol. 10r (incipit of the Gospel of Matthew): wide, coloured (red, yellow, green and white), ornamental band over col. a-b, with three lateral extensions decorated with geometric motifs, reaching the bottom of the text; the middle extension ends with a red horizontal base; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses); in the upper part an inscription ዘልደት. - Fol. 23ra: Crude ornamental band. - Fol. 45r (incipit of the Gospel of Mark): wide, coloured (red, yellow, green and white), ornamental band over col. a-b, with three short lateral extensions (probably incomplete) decorated with geometric motifs; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses); in the upper part two inscriptions ዘጥምቀት and ዘ፵ ጾም. - Fol. 73r (incipit of the Gospel of Luke): wide, coloured (red, yellow, blue and white), ornamental band over col. a-b, with three lateral extensions decorated with geometric motifs reaching half of the page; the horizontal band extends to the top of the page (interlaces, crosses); in the upper part an inscription ዘዘካርያስ.
